H0.text: Abdomen is the third main body segment of an arthropod, alongside the head and thorax.

H1.text: Legs are the third main body segment of an arthropod, the other two segments being the head and thorax.

H2.text: Tail is the third main body segment of an arthropod, following the head and thorax.

H3.text: Gluteus is the third main body segment of an arthropod, along with the head and thorax.

A4.text: the three-part appearance of many insect bodies and the two-part appearance of spiders is a result of this grouping

A5.text: The body is organized into three interconnected units: the head, thorax and abdomen.

A6.text: the thorax carries the three pairs of legs
